intro: Rubus hirtus var. malacadenes, commonly known as the hairy bramble or Malacanen raspberry, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and dense, dark green foliage. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or black when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and a subject of interest in plant taxonomy.
